title: Ticket #1573: FiringExp...Value() returns the wrong value for an invalid TimerRemove
description:
UserPolicy::FiringExpressionValue() doesn't return -1 when used with a ClassAd that has an unidentified value for the ATTR_TIMER_REMOVE_CHECK attribute.

The unit test output: 

TEST:  Test that FiringExpressionValue() returns -1 after a call to AnalyzePolicy() with a ClassAd that has TimerRemove evaluate to undefined.
INPUT:
    ClassAd:  [ PeriodicRemove = true; PeriodicHold = true; JobStatus = 2; PeriodicRelease = true; TimerRemove = DoesNotExist; OnExitRemove = true; OnExitHold = true; CurrentTime = time() ]
EXPECTED OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  -1
ACTUAL OUTPUT:
    RETURN:  1
RESULT:  FAILURE, test failed at line 1752 (0 seconds)
check_ins: 2010-Aug-12 11:27   Check-in [18783]: Updated UserPolicy::AnalyzePolicy() so that an undefined TimerRemove attribute is handled like other undefined UserPolicy attributes. (#1571, #1572, #1573, #1574) (By Josh Slauson )
creator: slauson
